definition: to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: Are there any useful methods which help you get out of your ruts?
sentences.chinese: 還有什麼有益的方法幫人擺脫困頓？

sentences.english: In the second chapter, the thesis expounds the educational symbolized difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，文章論述了教育符號化的困頓。

sentences.english: Stuck in a relationship that was over years ago?
sentences.chinese: 是否困頓在一年前就已消亡的感情關係中？

sentences.english: I was beaten out by the long and difficult journey.
sentences.chinese: 長途艱辛跋涉使我困頓不堪。

sentences.english: Exhausted, he stumbled over to sit on a rock by Mary.
sentences.chinese: 然後他困頓不堪地一屁股坐在瑪麗旁邊的一塊岩石上。

sentences.english: When you are in a rut, tackle it by starting small.
sentences.chinese: 但你處於困頓中時，嘗試只開始處理一些小的事情。

sentences.english: Would mass e-interaction bog down the White House?
sentences.chinese: 互聯網上的互動會否讓白宮陷入困頓？

sentences.english: Just letting the cool water hit your face washes off the grime and stresses of the day.
sentences.chinese: 讓冷水在淋在臉上會沖走一天的困頓和壓力。

sentences.english: We need to reduce the burden of taxes that impoverish the economy .
sentences.chinese: 我們需要減輕導致經濟困頓的稅收負荷。

sentences.english: I personally see a rut as a productivity vacuum.
sentences.chinese: 我個人認爲困頓猶如生產力的扼殺器。

sentences.english: There wasn't enough and you still had reasons to smile.
sentences.chinese: 看上去很困頓你卻依然有理由面帶笑靨。

definition: to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
